text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so today 
i'm making creamy thai tea ice cream bars using no

machines but instead we're going to use a special 
ingredient that's going to keep the ice cream

soft and smooth without churning it's actually 
an old-school thai method that i really think

deserves a comeback let's get started first order 
of business we need to prep the mold because ice

cream is going to go from the stove into the mold 
right away so you're not going to have time later

so you can use popsicle molds of course but to 
do it the traditional way you can use any old

rectangular dish and then we're going to cut 
it into pieces later and yes indeed in thai

this is called Itim Tud which means cut ice cream 
and to prep the dish i simply oiled the dish

and then line it with parchment paper and the oil 
is going to help the parchment stick to the side

and then you want a lot of overhang because you're 
going to use that to pull out the ice cream later

and just secure the sides with some paper 
clip that's all that's out of the way now

let's brew the tea but first i need to 
boil water which i have not done so cut

let's brew the thai tea so you will need thai 
tea leaves which you can buy at any asian grocery

source any brands will work for this and to brew 
it's very simple i'm just gonna pour in some

hot off the boiled water give that a stir and now 
i'm gonna let that steep for five minutes it's

been five minutes i'm gonna strain it now because 
there is orange food coloring in here you want

to line your counter with something because this 
could stain okay pro tip i'm gonna pour this into

a fine mesh strainer the finest one that 
you have preferably something bigger

it's okay and then you want to push out as much 
liquid as possible without being obsessive about

it there we go and you should end up with a little 
more than a cup of liquid you don't want to use

this right away because there's a lot of really 
fine tea dust in thai tea so you want to let it

sit for just a minute or so to let all that dust 
settle so we don't pour that into the ice cream

while the dust settles let's deal with our 
special ingredient the secret to keeping ice

cream soft without a machine is tapioca starch 
yes and i'm using pine bran today who is also

our sponsor pine brand's flagship product is 
glass noodles which you've seen me use on the

show many times but they also make high quality 
tapioca starch that is pure with no additives and

i love their sturdy packaging which means i don't 
have to worry about flour leaking in my shopping

bag which i'm sure many of you can relate to 
tapioca is very versatile you can use it in

sweet and savory dishes i'll link to some recipes 
in the description but one of the most unexpected

uses of it is in keeping ice cream soft and i'll 
explain how that works in a minute we first want

to dissolve the starch by adding just some of our 
evaporated milk just enough so you can whisk it

you want to make sure all the lumps 
are gone before you add it to the pot

this could be any liquid that you're using 
by the way but i don't want to use the tea

because the tea is hot right now and it might 
cook the starch when you add to it so you want

to use cold or room temperature liquid 
and now i'm going to add this to our pot

followed by the rest of our evaporated milk 
and i made it so that this recipe uses up

a whole can of evaporated milk you're welcome for 
sweetness i'm going to add sweetened condensed

milk which is a key ingredient in thai tea 
and also a whole can how convenient right

i'm going to add some whipping cream for 
some creaminess and a little bit of salt

to balance all of that sweetness it's very 
very important do not forget the salt instead

of the whipping cream if you want something 
lighter you can go with milk or half and half

but the lower fat you go the icier and 
the harder the ice cream is going to be

which is not necessarily a bad thing especially 
if you're looking for something more refreshing

like more popsicle-ish but for me i'm looking for 
rich and creamy so whipping cream it is now i'm

gonna add our tea in and i'm just gonna pour 
it through my fine mesh skimmer one more time

just in case you don't really need it but 
make sure you hold back on the last little bit

where most of the dust is straight into the 
sink for no stains give everything a stir

to dissolve the condensed milk it's looking 
like thai tea already right like this is the

color right here and yes you can make this any 
other flavor that you want the technique applies

and i'll write more about that in the blog post 
so now that it's all dissolved i'm going to turn

the heat on just medium and then i'm going to 
keep stirring and it's very important that you

do not stop stirring because otherwise the starch 
is going to settle at the bottom and the ice cream

is not going to be thickened evenly what you want 
to do is bring this to a full boil and completely

cook the starch and it's going to thicken our ice 
cream base this is the key technique right here

so i'm waiting for two signs the first sign is 
it's going to start to bubble which means it's

reaching a boiling temperature and i'm looking 
for the thickness to stabilize so i'm cooking

and i'm cooking it's getting thicker and thicker 
and then it doesn't get any thicker anymore which

means the starch has done all the job that it 
can see when i stop it's starting to bubble

can you see the bubbles you can see movement 
there we go i'm seeing bubbles around the edges

and it hasn't gotten thicker in the last 
little while so i know that this is now done

i'm turning it off what's happening here is as the 
starch cooks it absorbs some liquid and it gels

up and in doing so it prevents that water from 
becoming frozen into ice crystals so that's how

starch works to help keep ice cream soft rather 
than freezing into a hard icy block now this is

not a unique technique to thailand there are many 
cultures around the world that use some sort of

starch to help improve the texture of their ice 
cream and i'll write more about that in the blog

okay the skin is going to form on this really 
quickly as you can see not to worry but this is

why we want to have our mold ready because it will 
get thicker and thicker as it cools and as it gets

thicker it will be hard for you to get a smooth 
surface when you pour it into your mold i'm going

to spoon this into my popsicle mold first and 
i love this popsicle mold because it's so small

and it's so cute and it's just the right snack 
size and now the traditional cut ice cream one

and see how it's super thick if this gets 
cold you won't be able to smooth the top

so right now it's hot enough 
that if i let it settle

the top will smooth out but if it's really cold 
you get lumpy bits we're gonna see some bubbles

we can just use a toothpick to get rid of those 
and that'll settle and smooth out as it sits

and that's it now you want to let this cool 
to room temperature before sticking it into

your freezer so as to not melt anything else 
in your freezer and then we're going to cut it

up so here's one that i made yesterday and to 
take this out you want to run the thin knife or

spatula along the sides without the parchment 
and then carefully lift the parchment overhang

you can run hot water under it to get it come out 
but i try not to do that because this melts pretty

easily and and it can you can go overboard really 
easily oh here we go i got it i got it i got this
yay
okay

now that that's over you can trim off the 
edges if you like for a clean cut and then

you can just cut it into whatever size you want 
and because of that starch the ice cream is soft

enough that yes you can just cut right through 
it the traditional way is to make rectangles

and then you use a wooden skewer to insert and 
there's your stick peel it off from the parchment

and there you go this is like classic traditional 
old school style right here if you want you can

also cut it into little cubes let me set this 
down for a second oh my god so cute imagine

this at a party you know you don't have to commit 
to like a big ice cream you can have a little one

how cute is that look at it moment of truth i 
want you to see how easily i can bite through this
look at that

it's so good oh it's just like a texture like 
you've never had before it's creamy it's soft

but because of the tapioca starch it's a little 
bit chewy and i mean that in the best possibly i

mean like this is ice cream you can chew which is 
awesome it melts perfectly the sweetness the thai

tea everything is coming through just right this 
is revolutionary right here i mean when was the

last time you made creamy ice cream simply by 
cooking something on the stove and freezing it

it's incredible so i hope you give this 
a try the recipe as always will be on

hatthaikitchen.com and a special thanks 
to all of our patreon members who help

support the show if you want to know 
what that's all about how you can get

perks and watch my videos ad free check 
out the link in the description below

thank you as always for watching and i will see 
you next time for your next delicious thai meal
